attributes.action: raise the issue of fair competion with the English Premier League / Football League and request they explore ways to reduce the inequitable dominance of the, so called, 'Big Four' teams in the various league and cup competions.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The opportunity to win the Premier League, FA/League Cups is now virtually restricted to those clubs competing in the UEFA Champions League (UCL), namely: Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool, Man Utd ('ACLM'), due to higher UCL revenues. The same teams also re-qualify for the UCL each year. This situation is unlikely to change, unless some aspects of the league/cup formats are altered. 
Possible options include:
1. Creating a new Pan-European super division, in which the top clubs play full time, rather than in their own national leagues, but with relegation/promotion to/from the national leagues (e.g. 4 English places, with 2 up/down each year). 
2. Entry to the English League Cup is restricted to non-UEFA Champions League teams. 
3. Some redistribution of UCL revenues to narrow the UCL / non-UCL gap. 
If the situation is not addressed, non-ACLM supporters could withdraw their support from televised games featuring the UCL teams, in protest at this in-built inequality.
